required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Food Reinforcement, Weight Status, and Energy Density
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Daily Snack Food Intake on Food Reinforcement Depend on Weight Status and Energy Density

lead_sponsor.agency: State University of New York at Buffalo

clinical_study.source: State University of New York at Buffalo

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators previous studies have shown that obese and non-obese individuals respond differently to daily intake of snack food. The purpose of this study was to determine whether these differences are specific to high energy density snack foods. The investigators hypothesized that obese individuals would show an increase in motivation to obtain high energy density snack foods after two weeks of daily consumption, but that non-obese women and obese women consuming low energy density foods would have reduced motivation to consume snack foods after two weeks of daily consumption.

primary_outcome.description: Participants were asked to click a mouse button to gain access to food. A point was earned after a certain number of button presses and after 5 points were earned, the participant received 100 kcal portion of food.

secondary_outcome.description: participants rated how much they liked the food on a Likert-type scale.

arm_group.description: Non-obese women given 60 gram portions of high energy density snack foods to consume daily for two weeks.
Non-obese participants that were given 60 gram portions of low energy density foods to consume daily for two weeks.
Obese participants that were given 60 gram portions of low energy density snack foods to consume daily for two weeks.
Obese participants that were given 60 gram portions of high energy density snack foods to consume daily for two weeks.

intervention.description: participants consumed 60 gram portions of either low energy density or high energy density snack foods every day for two weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 - 50 years old, female, like study foods.
Exclusion Criteria:
- current smoker, currently on a diet, medical conditions or medication affecting appetite (ex. methylphenidate).

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: State University of New York at Buffalo
